sen.j: 北畠 満雅（きたばたけ みつまさ、？ － 正長元年12月21日 (旧暦)（1429年1月25日））は、室町時代前期の人物。
sen.e: Mitsumasa KITABATAKE (date of birth unknown - January 25, 1429) was a person who lived during the early Muromachi period.
Mitsumasa KITABATAKE (date of birth unknown - January 25, 1429) lived during the early Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 人物を訳する必要がないのでは，と考え省きました。
sen.e: Mitsumasa KITABATAKE (date of birth unknown - January 25, 1429) lived during the early Muromachi period.

sen.j: 伊勢国司北畠家の第3代当主。
sen.e: Third family head of the Kitabatake family, Ise Kokushi (an officer of Ise Province).
He was the third family head of the Kitabatake family, whose members served as Ise Kokushi (an officer of Ise Province) from generation to generation.
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。伊勢国司北畠家のニュアンスをだすために書き換えました。
sen.e: He was the third family head of the Kitabatake family, whose members served as Ise Kokushi (an officer of Ise Province) from generation to generation.
Second son of Akiyasu KITABATAKE.
He was the second son of Akiyasu KITABATAKE.
He was the second son of Akiyasu KITABATAKE.

sen.j: 1412年8月、皇統が北朝 (日本)から南朝 (日本)に譲られないことを不服として伊勢で挙兵したが、土岐氏によって鎮圧される。
sen.e: In August 1412, he took up arms in Ise because he was dissatisfied with the fact that the imperial line was not given from the Northern Court (Japan) to the Southern Court (Japan), but he was suppressed by the Toki family.

In protest against the fact that the imperial line was not transferred from the Northern Court (Japan) to the Southern Court (Japan), he raised an army in Ise Province only to be suppressed by the Toki clan in August 1412.
sen.cmt: 単語調査に基づき変更を加え，わかりづらい箇所を書き換えました。
sen.e: In protest against the fact that the imperial line was not transferred from the Northern Court (Japan) to the Southern Court (Japan), he raised an army in Ise Province only to be suppressed by the Toki clan in August 1412.

sen.j: ところが1414年9月に再挙兵している。
sen.e: However, he took up arms again in September 1414.
However, he raised an army again in September 1414.
sen.cmt: 単語調査に基づき変更を加えました。
sen.e: However, he raised an army again in September 1414.

sen.j: しかし足利義持の命令を受けた土岐持益 (守護)・仁木満長らの軍勢に敗れて、翌年8月に朝廷の仲介のもとに降伏した。
sen.e: However, he was defeated by the army of Mochimasu TOKI (Shugo (a provincial military governor) and Mitsunaga FUTAKI who received the order from Yoshimoti ASHIKAGA and surrendered at the mediation of Imperial Court in August next year.

After being defeated by the army of Mochimasu TOKI (Shugo [a provincial military governor]), Mitsunaga FUTAKI and others obeying Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA, he surrendered to them through the mediation of the Imperial Court in August of the following year.
sen.cmt: 土岐持益 (守護)・仁木満長らの軍勢で書き換え，わかりづらい箇所も書き換えました。()内括弧を[]に換えました。義持にスペルミスがあります。
sen.e: After being defeated by the army of Mochimasu TOKI (Shugo [a provincial military governor]), Mitsunaga FUTAKI and others obeying Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA, he surrendered to them through the mediation of the Imperial Court in August of the following year.

sen.j: ところが1428年8月、称光天皇が崩御して北朝の嫡流が断絶すると、今度は小倉宮聖承（聖承）の息子を皇位につけようと画策する。
sen.e: However, when Emperor Shoko died and the direct descendant of the Northern Court was extinguished, he attempted to let the son of Seisho OGURANOMIYA to succeed the throne.

Following the death of the Emperor Shoko in August 1428, which led to the extinction of the direct descendant of the Northern Court, he attempted to let the son of Seisho OGURANOMIYA ascend the throne.
sen.cmt: 使役動詞の使い方を訂正，「皇位につく」を原文とおり訳しました。年号が訳漏れです。
sen.e: Following the death of the Emperor Shoko in August 1428, which led to the extinction of the direct descendant of the Northern Court, he attempted to let the son of Seisho OGURANOMIYA ascend the throne.

sen.j: しかし伏見宮家から後花園天皇が立てられたため、この陰謀は頓挫した。
sen.e: However, since Emperor GohHanazono was backed up by the Fushiminomiya family, the conspiracy was frustrated.
His attempt was, however, frustrated, because the Fushiminomiya family produced the new emperor, the Emperor Gohanazono.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: His attempt was, however, frustrated, because the Fushiminomiya family produced the new emperor, the Emperor Gohanazono.

sen.j: そして小倉宮が満雅を頼って伊勢に下向してくると、満雅は小倉宮を奉じてまたも挙兵する。
sen.e: When Oguranomiya went down to Ise for the support of Mitsumasa, Mitsumasa raised an army again in the name of Oguranomiya.
After Oguranomiya entered Ise Province, who left the capital trusting to Mitsumasa, he raised an army again under the banner of Oguranomiya.
sen.cmt: 原文のニュアンスをだすために書き換えました。
sen.e: After Oguranomiya entered Ise Province, who left the capital trusting to Mitsumasa, he raised an army again under the banner of Oguranomiya.

sen.j: しかしこれに激怒した足利義教により派遣された土岐持頼率いる幕府軍に攻められた。
sen.e: However, he was attacked by the army of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) led by Mochiyori TOKI dispatched by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA who went angry with it and died in the Battle of Abu Country, Ise Province.
The army of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) commanded by Mochiyori TOKI, who was dispatched by outraged Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, attacked him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。全体にbyが多くわかりづらいので多少書き換えました。
sen.e: The army of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) commanded by Mochiyori TOKI, who was dispatched by outraged Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, attacked him.

sen.j: 伊勢阿濃郡岩田の戦いで戦死した。
sen.e: As a result, Mitsumasa was killed in the Battle of Iwata, Abu Country, Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「岩田」が訳漏れです。
sen.e: As a result, Mitsumasa was killed in the Battle of Iwata, Abu Country, Ise Province.
